intro: Basicarpus, commonly known as the evergreen holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. These plants are native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere, particularly in Europe and Asia. They are shrubs that typically have dark green, leathery leaves and produce small, bell-shaped flowers. The fruits are usually berries that contain one or two seeds. Basicarpus species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in acidic soils.
